title: Unit 1: Greetings and Introductions
description: Learn basic German greetings and how to introduce yourself.
content:
## Common German Greetings

- **Hallo** - Hello
- **Guten Morgen** - Good morning
- **Guten Tag** - Good day
- **Guten Abend** - Good evening
- **Auf Wiedersehen** - Goodbye
- **Tschüss** - Bye (informal)

## Introducing Yourself

- **Ich heiße [Name]** - My name is [Name]
- **Ich bin [Name]** - I am [Name]
- **Wie heißt du?** - What's your name? (informal)
- **Wie heißen Sie?** - What's your name? (formal)
- **Woher kommst du?** - Where are you from? (informal)
- **Woher kommen Sie?** - Where are you from? (formal)
- **Ich komme aus [Country]** - I come from [Country]

## Practice Conversation

A: Hallo! Wie heißt du?
B: Hallo! Ich heiße Maria. Und du?
A: Ich bin Thomas. Woher kommst du?
B: Ich komme aus den USA. Und du?
A: Ich komme aus Kanada. Nett, dich kennenzulernen!
B: Nett, dich auch kennenzulernen!

title: Unit 2: Numbers 1-20
description: Learn to count from one to twenty in German.
content:
## German Numbers 1-20

- 1 - eins
- 2 - zwei
- 3 - drei
- 4 - vier
- 5 - fünf
- 6 - sechs
- 7 - sieben
- 8 - acht
- 9 - neun
- 10 - zehn
- 11 - elf
- 12 - zwölf
- 13 - dreizehn
- 14 - vierzehn
- 15 - fünfzehn
- 16 - sechzehn
- 17 - siebzehn
- 18 - achtzehn
- 19 - neunzehn
- 20 - zwanzig

## Usage Tips

- When giving your age: **Ich bin [number] Jahre alt** - I am [number] years old
- When giving your phone number, Germans usually say each digit separately
- When giving prices, use **Euro** after the number: **Das kostet fünf Euro** - That costs five euros

title: Unit 3: Present Tense Verbs
description: Learn how to conjugate regular verbs in the present tense.
content:
## Regular Verb Conjugation in Present Tense

In German, verbs change their form depending on the subject. Here's the pattern for regular verbs:

### Example with "spielen" (to play)

- ich spiele - I play
- du spielst - You play (informal singular)
- er/sie/es spielt - He/she/it plays
- wir spielen - We play
- ihr spielt - You play (informal plural)
- sie/Sie spielen - They/You play (formal)

### Example with "arbeiten" (to work)

- ich arbeite - I work
- du arbeitest - You work (informal singular)
- er/sie/es arbeitet - He/she/it works
- wir arbeiten - We work
- ihr arbeitet - You work (informal plural)
- sie/Sie arbeiten - They/You work (formal)

## Practice Exercises

1. Conjugate "lernen" (to learn) for all persons
2. Conjugate "wohnen" (to live) for all persons
3. Create sentences with different subjects and the verb "machen" (to do/make)

title: Unit 4: Common Phrases for Travelers
description: Essential German phrases for traveling in German-speaking countries.
content:
## Essential Travel Phrases

### Basic Communication
- **Entschuldigung** - Excuse me / Sorry
- **Sprechen Sie Englisch?** - Do you speak English?
- **Ich verstehe nicht** - I don't understand
- **Können Sie das bitte wiederholen?** - Can you please repeat that?
- **Wie bitte?** - Pardon? / Come again?

### Finding Your Way
- **Wo ist...?** - Where is...?
- **Wie komme ich zu...?** - How do I get to...?
- **Ist es weit?** - Is it far?
- **rechts** - right
- **links** - left
- **geradeaus** - straight ahead

### At Restaurants
- **Ich möchte bestellen** - I would like to order
- **Die Speisekarte, bitte** - The menu, please
- **Die Rechnung, bitte** - The bill, please
- **Prost!** - Cheers!
- **Es war sehr lecker** - It was very delicious

### Emergencies
- **Hilfe!** - Help!
- **Ich brauche einen Arzt** - I need a doctor
- **Rufen Sie einen Krankenwagen!** - Call an ambulance!

title: Unit 5: Food Vocabulary
description: Learn common German words for food and drinks.
content:
## Food Vocabulary

### Meals
- **das Frühstück** - breakfast
- **das Mittagessen** - lunch
- **das Abendessen** - dinner

### Fruits
- **der Apfel** - apple
- **die Banane** - banana
- **die Orange** - orange
- **die Erdbeere** - strawberry
- **die Weintraube** - grape

### Vegetables
- **die Kartoffel** - potato
- **die Tomate** - tomato
- **die Gurke** - cucumber
- **der Salat** - lettuce/salad
- **die Zwiebel** - onion

### Meat & Fish
- **das Fleisch** - meat
- **das Huhn** - chicken
- **das Rindfleisch** - beef
- **das Schweinefleisch** - pork
- **der Fisch** - fish

### Drinks
- **das Wasser** - water
- **der Kaffee** - coffee
- **der Tee** - tea
- **der Saft** - juice
- **das Bier** - beer
- **der Wein** - wine

### Common Phrases
- **Ich habe Hunger** - I am hungry
- **Ich habe Durst** - I am thirsty
- **Guten Appetit!** - Enjoy your meal!

title: Unit 6: German Cases
description: Introduction to the four German cases and their usage.
content:
## The Four German Cases

German has four cases that change the form of articles and adjectives:

### 1. Nominative Case (Nominativ)
- Used for the subject of a sentence
- **Der** Mann ist groß. - **The** man is tall.
- **Die** Frau ist nett. - **The** woman is nice.
- **Das** Kind spielt. - **The** child plays.

### 2. Accusative Case (Akkusativ)
- Used for the direct object
- Ich sehe **den** Mann. - I see **the** man.
- Ich sehe **die** Frau. - I see **the** woman.
- Ich sehe **das** Kind. - I see **the** child.

### 3. Dative Case (Dativ)
- Used for the indirect object
- Ich gebe **dem** Mann ein Buch. - I give **the** man a book.
- Ich gebe **der** Frau ein Buch. - I give **the** woman a book.
- Ich gebe **dem** Kind ein Buch. - I give **the** child a book.

### 4. Genitive Case (Genitiv)
- Expresses possession
- Das Buch **des** Mannes. - **The** man's book.
- Das Buch **der** Frau. - **The** woman's book.
- Das Buch **des** Kindes. - **The** child's book.

## Case Table for Definite Articles

|          | Masculine | Feminine | Neuter | Plural |
|----------|-----------|----------|--------|--------|
|Nominative| der       | die      | das    | die    |
|Accusative| den       | die      | das    | die    |
|Dative    | dem       | der      | dem    | den    |
|Genitive  | des       | der      | des    | der    |
